title: Server-Side Rendering vs Static Generation
content:
Module 9, Lesson 5: Server-Side Rendering vs Static Generation

The Hook

SSR generates HTML on each request (good for dynamic data); SSG generates HTML at build time (good for static content). Next.js supports both, plus ISR for incremental static regeneration.

In this lesson, we explore how Server-Side Rendering vs Static Generation fits within the broader context of Performance Optimisation. Building a solid understanding of these concepts will make you a more effective and confident full-stack developer.

The Concept

1. Core Principles

The core principles behind Server-Side Rendering vs Static Generation are grounded in decades of software engineering practice. These principles — separation of concerns, single responsibility, and fail-fast design — provide a reliable foundation for production-quality code.

2. Implementation Patterns

Experienced developers recognise patterns for Server-Side Rendering vs Static Generation that solve common problems efficiently. Understanding when to apply each pattern — and knowing the trade-offs — separates good developers from great ones.

3. Performance Implications

Every technical decision in Server-Side Rendering vs Static Generation has performance implications. Understanding the performance characteristics of different approaches helps you make informed choices that scale well under real-world loads.

4. Security Considerations

Security must be considered from the first line of code, not bolted on at the end. The security considerations relevant to Server-Side Rendering vs Static Generation are concrete and actionable: if you understand them, you can prevent the most common vulnerabilities.

5. Testing and Debugging

Effective testing of Server-Side Rendering vs Static Generation components ensures reliability and enables confident refactoring. Debugging skills — knowing how to isolate, reproduce, and fix issues — are equally important and developed only through practice.

The Illustration

You have completed Server-Side Rendering vs Static Generation within the Performance Optimisation module. The key takeaways are: the core principles; common implementation patterns and their trade-offs; performance characteristics; security considerations; and testing approaches. Apply these insights in your next project and notice the difference in code quality and confidence. Continue to the next lesson to deepen your expertise.
